Requirements:
All first-year applicants must submit the following:

Common Application or University of New Haven Application. There is no application fee to apply.

Official High School Transcript. An official transcript can be sent by a school counselor electronically or by mail. Self-reported academic record (SRAR) is also an option for students who have only attended a high school in the United States.

One Letter of Recommendation. We require one letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher. The letter of recommendation can be sent electronically or by mail.
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Accounting program at the University of New Haven prepares you to launch a successful career in the fast-paced and rewarding accounting field. You will develop a deep understanding of financial accounting, managerial accounting, auditing, taxation, and accounting information systems. Our curriculum is designed to not only meet the educational requirements for CPA licensure in many states but also to equip you with the critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills necessary to excel in various accounting roles. You will be prepared for a wide range of opportunities in public accounting, corporate accounting, government, and non-profit organizations. Many of our graduates pursue further education, including our Master of Science in Accounting, to meet the 150-hour requirement for CPA licensure. Our dedicated faculty, many of whom have real-world experience, provide personalized attention and mentorship, ensuring you gain practical insights and develop strong professional networks.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Actuarial Science
Description: As an actuarial science student at the University of New Haven, you will engage in a rigorous curriculum that provides a strong theoretical foundation in mathematics, statistics, finance, and economics. You will also develop professional skills necessary for a successful career in the actuarial field. The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Actuarial Science program at the University of New Haven is designed to provide students with the necessary background to pass the preliminary examinations of the Society of Actuaries (SOA) and the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS). Our program is listed in the Society of Actuaries Universities and Colleges with Actuarial Programs (UCAP) under the Advanced Curriculum (AC) category. This listing indicates that our curriculum covers the Validation by Educational Experience (VEE) requirements in Economics, Corporate Finance, and Applied Statistical Methods, and that we offer courses covering the learning objectives for at least two of the following SOA/CAS preliminary examinations: Probability (P), Financial Mathematics (FM), Investment and Financial Markets (IFM), Long-Term Actuarial Mathematics (LTAM), Short-Term Actuarial Mathematics (STAM), and Regression Analysis (SRM).
Accredidation: Our program is listed in the Society of Actuaries Universities and Colleges with Actuarial Programs (UCAP) under the Advanced Curriculum (AC) category. This listing indicates that our curriculum covers the Validation by Educational Experience (VEE) requirements in Economics, Corporate Finance, and Applied Statistical Methods, and that we offer courses covering the learning objectives for at least two of the following SOA/CAS preliminary examinations: Probability (P), Financial Mathematics (FM), Investment and Financial Markets (IFM), Long-Term Actuarial Mathematics (LTAM), Short-Term Actuarial Mathematics (STAM), and Regression Analysis (SRM).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Art & Creative Technology
Requirements: In order to complete your application, we will need the following information: Common Application or University of New Haven Application; Official High School Transcript(s); One Letter of Recommendation (from a school counselor or teacher); Personal Essay/Personal Statement; $50 Application Fee or Fee Waiver.
Description: In the Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) program in Art & Creative Technology, students will learn to create, innovate, design, and share using a wide range of artistic and technological tools. This program, part of the University’s interdisciplinary Fine Arts Department, is built around core studio and art history courses, but it also provides students with the opportunity to pursue the areas of study in the fine arts that most interest them. The B.A. program allows students to take a substantial number of elective credits outside the major, giving them the flexibility to pursue a minor in another field of study or to fulfill the requirements for a second major. Many Art & Creative Technology B.A. students choose to combine their major with a minor in Business, Digital Media, Communication, or Marketing.

Requirements:
To apply for first-year admission to the University of New Haven, please submit the following:

A completed Common Application, including the University of New Haven member screen and a personal essay
Official high school transcript(s)
One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher (additional letters are welcome)
SAT and/or ACT scores (optional for most majors)
An application fee of $50 (waivers are available for students who demonstrate financial need)
Concentration: American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (ASBMB) Certified Track, Pre-Health Professions Track
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Biochemistry program prepares students for careers and further education in chemistry, biochemistry, and molecular biology. The curriculum is interdisciplinary, combining elements from both the chemistry and biology departments. It has been approved by the American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (ASBMB) as a certified degree program, which allows our students to participate in ASBMB's certification exam. Students in the program may pursue two distinct tracks: the American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (ASBMB) Certified Track or the Pre-Health Professions Track. Both tracks include hands-on experience in modern research methods using state-of-the-art instrumentation. Our graduates are highly competitive for employment in a variety of scientific fields, as well as for admission to graduate programs in biochemistry, molecular biology, and other related fields (including medical, dental, and pharmacy school).
Accredidation: Approved by the American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (ASBMB) as a certified degree program.

Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit the following: Completed Common Application or University of New Haven Application, Official high school transcript(s), One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher, Personal essay or graded paper, SAT or ACT scores (optional for most majors).
Concentration: Marine Biology, Cell and Molecular Biology, Ecology and Environmental Biology, Health Professions
Description: Biology is the study of life and living organisms, from molecules to ecosystems. The Bachelor of Science in Biology program at the University of New Haven will provide you with a solid foundation in the fundamental principles of biology. You’ll gain a comprehensive understanding of biological processes, mechanisms, and interactions, while also developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and research skills. Our curriculum covers a broad range of biological topics, including molecular biology, cell biology, genetics, ecology, evolution, and physiology. You'll engage in hands-on laboratory experiences, field work, and research projects that will allow you to apply theoretical knowledge to real-world scenarios. Our faculty members are experts in their respective fields, and they are dedicated to providing you with personalized attention and mentorship. Graduates of our B.S. in Biology program are well-prepared for a variety of careers in health professions, research, environmental science, biotechnology, and education. Many of our alumni pursue advanced degrees in medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, physician assistant studies, physical therapy, and other related fields. You'll also be well-equipped for entry-level positions in pharmaceutical companies, government agencies, non-profit organizations, and academic institutions.
